title: April 15: Refugees & Immigrants in The Triangle (Guest Speakers) (Hillsborough)
description:
Hillsborough Progressives Taking Action (HPTA) is thrilled to have guest speakers Marty Rosenbluth and Jennie Belle speak to us about the current environment for refugees and immigrants in The Triangle. Our guests will share their experiences working with refugees and immigrants, how new regulations impact refugees/immigrants, and most importantly what we can do to help. We will open up the floor to questions towards the end.

This will be a fantastic event as we are so fortunate to have such notable and accomplished professionals give us their time. Please join us!

Marty Rosenbluth bio
Marty Rosenbluth is currently an Associate Attorney at the Polanco Law Firm PC where he is in charge of the Lumpkin, GA office. He recently returned from 6 weeks in Greece helping refugees from Syria and other countries to apply for asylum in Europe and has also volunteered for a month with the CARA Pro-Bono Project in Dilley, TX. He has attended meetings both at the White House and at ICE HQ to discuss immigration policy. Marty has spoken extensively on immigrant rights and human rights both throughout the US and overseas. Prior to attending law school, Marty worked as a human rights researcher for Al-Haq, the West Bank affiliate of the International Commission of Jurists. He is a graduate of the UNC School of Law.

Jennie Belle bio
Jennie was born and raised in Savannah, GA. She moved to Texas for her undergraduate education at Rice University, during which time she studied in Mexico, Peru and Argentina and participated in service projects in Central America. After graduation she moved to Spain for a year to teach English. Jennie then came to North Carolina for a dual degree M.Div./M.S.W. graduate program at Duke and UNC-Chapel Hill where her work focused on advocating for farmworkers and organizing churches for social justice. Jennie currently serves as the Program Director for Farmworker and Immigrant Rights at the NC Council of Churches.
